docs.snippet: McALLEN, Texas, Dec. 5. -- With the withdrawal of the resignation of the forty staff and line officers of the Twelfth New York Infantry today, the departure of Colonel Gordon Johnston, and the assumption of command by two regular army officers, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: McALLEN, Texas, Dec. 5. -- With the withdrawal of the resignation of the forty staff and line officers of the Twelfth New York Infantry today, the departure of Colonel Gordon Johnston, and the assumption of command by two regular army officers, the row over the repetition of the review of the regiment and the alleged insult to the flag subsided.
docs.abstract: officers of 12th Regt. withdraw resignations, fight on Maj. Gen. O'Ryan to be renewed when Regt. returns home

headline.main: TWELFTH'S OFFICERS DECIDE NOT TO QUIT; Withdraw Resignations Offered Because of Gen. O'Ryan's Order at Review. COLONEL JOHNSTON LEAVES Fight on Major General May Be Renewed When Regiment Gets Back to New York.

docs.snippet: A dozen big motor trucks, under a strong guard, deposited $25,000,000 in United States gold coin at the Sub-Treasury yesterday and at about the same time $8,000,000 in gold was delivered at the Mint in Philadelphia. Combined they constituted the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A dozen big motor trucks, under a strong guard, deposited $25,000,000 in United States gold coin at the Sub-Treasury yesterday and at about the same time $8,000,000 in gold was delivered at the Mint in Philadelphia. Combined they constituted the largest single shipment ever brought into the country.

headline.main: BIGGEST GOLD INFLUX HERE FROM OTTAWA; Britain Sends $33,000,000, the Largest Shipment Ever Made to This Country. AMERICAN COINS RETURNED Part of $40,000,000 Paid France for Panama Canal Rights Included -- Further Imports Expected.

docs.snippet: BUSINESS in Uruguay in 1916 has been fundamentally affected by world conditions as created by the European war. A curtailment of imports, due chiefly to the inability of the great European and North American manufacturing countries to supply the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUSINESS in Uruguay in 1916 has been fundamentally affected by world conditions as created by the European war. A curtailment of imports, due chiefly to the inability of the great European and North American manufacturing countries to supply the goods needed by Uruguay, and a substantial increase of exports, based on the increased need of raw materials at advanced prices all the world over, are the principal features of the commercial year.

headline.main: TRADE TO BE HAD FOR THE SEEKING; Uruguayan Representative Says We Can Hold Trade Gained in War If We Try.
